snippet: The Pennsylvania legislature is considering a cigarette tax for the city that would make the budget reductions temporary.
abstract: Philadelphia Schools Superintendent William R Hite Jr announces series of temporary spending cuts aimed at helping administrators close $81 million budget deficit that threatened to delay school opening; says schools will open as planned in September.

byline.original: By MOTOKO RICH and JON HURDLE

lead_paragraph: The Pennsylvania legislature is considering a cigarette tax for the city that would make the budget reductions temporary.

headline.main: Philadelphia Schools to Open on Time Amid Millions in Budget Cuts
headline.print_headline: Philadelphia Schools to Open on Time Amid Millions in Budget Cuts
